description: UserAchievements achievement.json schema. An achievement's achievement.json definition, along with all supporting files (internationalization messages, images, etc.) must be contained in a subdirectory of the "achievements" directory of the UserAchievements extension. The name of this subdirectory defines the case-sensitive id of the achievement. For consistency, many fields use the same names as the extension.json schema. However, only a limited subset of these fields are supported for achievements.

id.description: The id of the achievement. This must be unique across all achievements. If not specified, will default to the class name (without the namespace).

class.description: The full class name (including namespace) of the achievement

classfile.description: The relative path to the achievement class php file. If not specified, will default to the class name (without the namespace) in the same directory as the json definition.

version.description: The version of this release of the achievement.

name.description: Raw display name of the achievement. If not specified, this will default to the achievement's id.

namemsg.description: i18n message key of the achievement's name. If not specified, will attempt to use the message key "userachievements-ACHIEVEMENTID-name". If a valid message is defined, this will take precedence over the value of "name".

descriptionmsg.description: i18n message key of the achievement's description. If not specified, will attempt to use the message key "userachievements-ACHIEVEMENTID-desc". If a valid message is defined, this will take precedence over the value of "description".

priority.description: The number of levels of the achievement which can be awarded.

secret.description: Should the achievement be listed as available prior to being achieved.

levels.description: The number of levels of the achievement which can be awarded.

color.description: The primary color of the achievement.

secret.description: Should the badge be listed as available prior to being achieved.

color.description: The primary color of the badge.

requiredStats.description: The minimum required stats to automatically award the badge. The properties correspond to the ids of the stat with the minimum required value for the stat as values.

stats.description: Defines the stats and default values used by this achievement, with the stat ids as properties and the default values as values.

config.description: Configuration options for this achievement. Unlike the extension.json definition of this field, this should be a simple object with the variable names as properties and default values as values.

AutoloadClasses.description: A list of classes and files to autoload. This should be a simple object with the class name as properties and the local path to the class files function as values.

AvailableRights.description: User rights added by the class.

GroupPermissions.description: Default permissions to give to usergroup. This should be a two dimensional object with the usergroup as the first dimension's properties, the rights as the second dimension, and a boolean to grant or deny the right as values.

Hooks.description: MediaWiki hooks which should trigger an attempt to achieve the achievement for the user. This should be a simple object with the hook as properties and the callback function as values. For default behavior, set the value to "tryAchieve"

MessagesDirs.description: Directory paths containing JSON internationalization data. Unlike the extension.json definition of this field, this should be a simple array of paths relative to the achievement's root.

ResourceFileModulePaths.description: Specifies the default paths to use for all ResourceLoader file modules.
